|ancient memory.

|wanted to watch them forever.

|Beach was so fulfilling.

|myself.

103.あなたに 連れていってもらって|いろんな場所で 絵を描いたわ。|あなたと一緒に: You took me to many places and I painted. I|saw many landscapes with you...

104.この世界は 美しい。|私は ここで 生きていきたい。|スケッチしながら そう願う: This world is beautiful. I want to live here.|I began to wish so while sketching.

105.私 絵を描くのが 好きよ。|そして それを 私に教えてくれた|あなたのことが……: I love to paint. And I love you for teaching|me how to do it.

106.ルシェンダさんの 呼びかけで|叡智の冠と呼ばれる 賢者さんたちが|集まってくれた: At Sage Lushenda's call, a group of the Sages,|known as the Crown of Wisdom, gathered.

107.とってもお茶目な ホーローさん。ずっと寝ている|ブロッゲンさんと おしゃべりな杖:
The very mischievous Mr. Hollow. Mr. Broggen,|who sleeps all the time, and Mr. Cane, who|talks a lot. Mr. Eidos is a little scary but|
|reliable.

108.ジャゴヌバ神殿で 私たちを助けてくれた|マリーンさんは 宝石魔術の使い手で|ユシ: Malynn, who saved us at the Jagonuba Temple,|was a master of gem magic and Yushka's Jewel.

109.大きくて 頼りがいのある マリーンさん。|子供のころのユシュカが あこがれて|弟: Malynn is big and dependable. I can understand|why Yushka, when she was a child, longed to|have her as an apprentice.

110.ばあやは 私の運命を 悲しんでくれるけど|私には 自分が消えてしまったとしても|: Grandmother is saddened by my fate, but there|are people I want to protect even if I|disappear. Grandmother is one of them.

111.アンルシアも絵を 描いてくれたのに|恥ずかしがって 消しちゃったの。彼女らしい|: Anlucia drew a picture for me, too, but she|was too shy to take it down. I liked it|because it was so typical of her.

112.グラデル台地は 雄大な景色と|あちこちに置かれた 不思議な彫刻の|両方を 楽しめ: The Gradel Plateau is a place where you can|enjoy both the magnificent scenery and the|mysterious sculptures placed here and there.

113.地面に穴があいてる場所があるって 気付いてた？|地下に空洞があって 天井が崩れ落:
Have you noticed that there are places where|there are holes in the ground? There is an|underground cavity and when the ceiling|
|collapses, a hole like that appears.

114.ある彫刻家さんが その穴に落ちたことがあって|救出された後も 三日三晩 泣いてい:
I heard that a sculptor once fell down that|hole and cried for three days and three nights|after he was rescued. Poor guy...he must have|
|been so scared.

115.それから 穴があいた場所や あきそうな場所は|柵で囲うようにしたんですって。|彫: Then, he fenced off all the holes and|potential openings. The sculptor's apprentice|told me about this.

116.ゲルヘナ幻野で にらみ合ったまま動かない|カエルさんと トカゲさん。|スケッチし: Frog and Lizard are standing motionless,|staring at each other in the Gerhena Field. I|was so nervous while I was sketching.

117.このトカゲさんは 魔界のあちこちに いるけど|とくに ファラザードで よく見かけ: These lizards can be found all over Demon|World, but especially in Farazard. ...in the|form of a roasted skewer.

118.シシカバブ団の サティに勧められて|私も 串焼きを 食べたことがあるの。|おいし: Sati from the Shish Kebab troupe once|recommended me to try their skewers. It was|delicious, but I felt guilty...

119.フィネトカから見える 光の大穴。|ここだけでなく 魔界やアストルティアの各地でも: The Great Pit of Light seen from Finetka. I|see rivers of light not only here, but also in|Demon World and other places in Astoltia.

120.はるか神話の時代 鏡合わせの秘儀によって|ジャゴヌバの身体を封じた ルティアナ様:
Mythical Age, the Lady Lutiana, who sealed|Jagonuba's body with the secret of mirror|matching, transformed her own body into a|
|river of light.

121.そして 魔瘴で けがされた大地……|魔界から アストルティアの地を守るため|その: And to protect the land of Astoltia from the|demon miasma, he separated the two worlds with|his own body.

122.魔界と アストルティアの狭間……。|光の河の中にある ルファ神殿。: Between Demon World and Astoltia lies the Rufa|Temple in the River of Light.

123.……ナラジアと一緒に|神魂融合の儀を おこないに行ったときは|見る余裕がなかった: I didn't have time to see it when I went with|Narasia to do the soul-melding ceremony, but|it's a solemn sight.

124.ゴダ神殿の魔瘴石の像から 私が解き放たれたとき|ルファ神殿の女神像の中で ナラジ:
When I was freed from the statue of the miasma|stone in Goda Temple, Narasia awoke in the|statue of the goddess in Rufa Temple. For we|
|were created to contain each other.

125.ナラジアは 自分の中に封じられた|ジャゴヌバの魂に 飲み込まれてしまった。|けど: Narasia was swallowed up by the spirit of|Jagonuba that was sealed inside her. But the|Narasia I knew... was a good girl.

126.ゼクレス城からの通路の出口にある 滝見の広場。|滝の流れ落ちる音と 水のせせらぐ:
Waterfall Plaza is located at the exit of the|passage from Zechres Castle. A peaceful place|where the only sounds are the cascading|
|waterfalls and rushing water.

127.子供のころのアスバルは|イヤなことがあると ここに来て|滝を ながめていたんです: As a child, Asbal used to come here to gaze at|the waterfall whenever he had a bad day.

128.たしかに 悲しいことも つらいことも|洗い流してくれるような……|そんな やさし: Indeed, I feel a kindness that washes away|sadness and pain.

129.バルディスタ城の窓から ながめた景色。|スケッチをしている間も ずっと|涼しい風: A view from the window of Valdista Castle. It|was nice to have a cool breeze blowing in|while I was sketching.

130.ヴァレリアさんも よく 窓の前に立って|景色をながめているそうよ。大魔王城での宴:
Valeria often stands in front of the window|and looks out at the view. Bertro, who was|drunk during the banquet at the Great Demon|
|King's castle, told me about it.

131.ヴァレリアさんは 町を ながめながら|どんなことを 思うのかな？|ふふ。なんだか:
I wonder what Valeria thinks as she looks out|over the town? I wonder what Valeria thinks as|she looks out over the town. I feel like I|
|want to talk to you.

132.ヴァレリアさんの焼いてくれるパイも とっても|おいしいの！ アンルシアも誘って|: Valeria bakes the most delicious pies! Maybe I|should invite Anlucia to come to Valdista with|me?

133.ザードの尖塔の てっぺんは|とても高くて 強い風が吹いて……|すこし怖いけど 清: The top of the Zard Spire is so high and the|wind is blowing so hard... it's a little|scary, but it's refreshing.

134.じつは 私 魔界大戦が起きる直前……|ファラザードに 連れ去られている間に|ここ: Actually, I climbed here once just before the|Demon World War while Farazard was taking me|away.

135.ユシュカが築いた ファラザードは|人々も町も 活気にあふれているのが|遠くからで: Even from afar, I could tell that the people|and the town of Farazard, built by Yushka,|were full of vitality.

136.この景色を もう一度|あなたと一緒に見たいって 思ってたの。|願いを かなえてく: I've always wanted to see this view with you|again. Thank you for granting my wish!

137.光の河から 分かたれて……|最初に 思い浮かんだのは あなたの姿だった。: As I parted from the river of light the first|thing that came to mind was you.

138.あなたに会いたい。|そう思って……気が付いたら|私は ここに いたの。: I want to meet you. That's what I thought...|and then I found myself here.
